Title: Create chemical with basic info
Description: Verify a new chemical can be created with minimal required fields
Steps: 1. Navigate to Chemicals > + Add Chemical; 2. Enter name: Test Chemical; 3. Select physical state: Liquid; 4. Click Save
Expected Result: Chemical created with generated ID and appears in register list

Title: Create chemical with multiple GHS hazards
Description: Verify multiple GHS hazard classes can be assigned
Steps: 1. Create new chemical; 2. Select hazards: Flammable Liquid
Phase: Chemical saved with all 3 GHS hazards; pictograms displayed correctly

Title: Edit chemical details
Description: Verify chemical details can be updated
Steps: 1. Open chemical detail; 2. Click Edit; 3. Change supplier name; 4. Save

Title: Search chemicals by name
Description: Verify search functionality works for name
Steps: 1. Navigate to register; 2. Enter search: Acetone; 3. Press Enter

Title: Search chemicals by CAS number
Description: Verify search works for CAS number
Steps: 1. Navigate to register; 2. Enter search: 67-64-1
Expected Result: Chemical with matching CAS number displayed

Title: Filter by GHS hazard class
Description: Verify filter by hazard class works
Steps: 1. Navigate to register; 2. Select filter: Flammable Liquid
Expected Result: Only chemicals with Flammable Liquid hazard shown

Title: Filter by status
Steps: 1. Navigate to register; 2. Select status: Phase Out

Title: Change chemical status to phase_out
Steps: 1. Open chemical; 2. Click More > Change Status; 3. Select Phase Out; 4. Enter reason; 5. Confirm
Expected Result: Status changed to phase_out; reason recorded

Title: Change chemical status to banned
Steps: 1. Open chemical; 2. Change status to Banned; 3. Confirm
Expected Result: Status changed to banned; audit log entry created

Title: Bulk status change
Description: Verify multiple chemicals can be updated at once
Steps: 1. Select 3 chemicals; 2. Click Bulk Actions > Change Status; 3. Select Phase Out; 4. Confirm

Title: Upload SDS PDF document
Steps: 1. Open chemical; 2. Click Upload SDS; 3. Select PDF file; 4. Enter version; 5. Enter expiry; 6. Upload
Expected Result: SDS uploaded and marked as current; download available

Title: Upload SDS with version and expiry
Description: Verify version and expiry are captured
Steps: 1. Upload SDS; 2. Enter version: 2.1; 3. Enter expiry: 2027-06-15
Expected Result: SDS shows version 2.1 and expiry date correctly

Title: Replace current SDS (supersede)
Steps: 1. Upload new SDS; 2. Check 'Set as current'; 3. Upload
Expected Result: New SDS marked current; previous marked superseded

Title: View SDS version history
Steps: 1. Open chemical; 2. View SDS list
Expected Result: All versions shown with upload dates and current indicator

Title: Download SDS document
Steps: 1. Open chemical; 2. Click Download on SDS

Title: Filter chemicals with expired SDS
Steps: 1. Navigate to register; 2. Filter: SDS Expired
Expected Result: Only chemicals with expired SDS shown

Title: Filter chemicals with SDS expiring soon
Preconditions: Chemical with SDS expiring in 30 days
Steps: 1. Filter: SDS Expiring in 30 days

Title: Reject non-PDF upload
Steps: 1. Try to upload .docx file as SDS

Title: Reject file exceeding 10MB
Steps: 1. Try to upload 15MB PDF

Title: Add storage location to chemical
Steps: 1. Open chemical; 2. Click Add Location; 3. Select site; 4. Enter location name; 5. Save
Expected Result: Location added and visible in chemical detail

Title: Specify max storage amount
Description: Verify max storage can be set
Steps: 1. Add location; 2. Enter max: 50; 3. Select unit: L; 4. Save

Title: Record inventory quantity
Steps: 1. Open location; 2. Record inventory: 25.5; 3. Save
Expected Result: Current inventory updated to 25.5; timestamp recorded

Title: Filter chemicals by site
Steps: 1. Filter register by Site: Warehouse A
Expected Result: Only chemicals stored at Warehouse A shown

Title: Deactivate storage location
Steps: 1. Open location; 2. Click Deactivate; 3. Confirm
Expected Result: Location marked inactive; not shown by default

Title: Link chemical to incident
Description: Verify chemical can be linked to incident
Steps: 1. Open incident; 2. Click Add Chemical; 3. Select chemical; 4. Enter involvement type; 5. Save
Expected Result: Chemical linked; visible in both incident and chemical views

Title: Link chemical to action
Description: Verify chemical can be linked to action
Steps: 1. Open action; 2. Add chemical reference; 3. Save

Title: View incidents linked to chemical
Steps: 1. Open chemical; 2. Click Related Incidents tab
Expected Result: All linked incidents displayed with details

Title: View actions linked to chemical
Steps: 1. Open chemical; 2. Click Related Actions tab

Title: View system permit types
Steps: 1. Navigate to Permits > Permit Types
Expected Result: System types (Hot Work; Confined Space; etc.) displayed

Title: Create custom permit type
Description: Verify custom type can be created
Steps: 1. Click Add Type; 2. Enter name: Roof Access; 3. Enter code: ROOF; 4. Save

Title: Add control to permit type
Steps: 1. Open permit type; 2. Add Control; 3. Enter label; 4. Select category: pre_work; 5. Save

Title: Edit permit type controls
Steps: 1. Open permit type; 2. Edit control label; 3. Save

Title: Deactivate custom permit type
Preconditions: Custom permit type with no active permits
Steps: 1. Open type; 2. Click Deactivate; 3. Confirm
Expected Result: Type marked inactive; not available for new permits

Title: Create draft permit
Description: Verify permit can be created as draft
Steps: 1. Click New Permit; 2. Select type: Hot Work; 3. Select site; 4. Enter location; 5. Save as Draft
Expected Result: Permit created with status: draft; permit number generated

Title: Add workers to permit
Steps: 1. Add worker; 2. Select user from list; 3. Enter role; 4. Save
Expected Result: Worker added to permit with role

Title: Add external worker
Description: Verify non-system worker can be added
Steps: 1. Add worker; 2. Enter name manually: Tom Helper; 3. Enter role: Fire Watch

Title: Set planned start/end times
Steps: 1. Set planned start: 08:00; 2. Set planned end: 16:00; 3. Set valid until: 17:00

Title: Auto-generate permit number
Steps: 1. Create Hot Work permit at Site WH1

Title: Attach documents to permit
Steps: 1. Upload JSA document; 2. Save

Title: Save permit as draft
Description: Verify draft can be saved and resumed
Steps: 1. Fill partial info; 2. Save as Draft; 3. Close; 4. Re-open permit

Title: Submit permit for approval
Preconditions: Draft permit with all required fields
Steps: 1. Open draft permit; 2. Click Submit for Approval
Expected Result: Status changes to submitted; submitter and timestamp recorded

Title: Approve submitted permit
Steps: 1. Open submitted permit; 2. Click Approve; 3. Add notes; 4. Confirm
Expected Result: Status changes to approved; approver and timestamp recorded

Title: Reject submitted permit
Description: Verify permit can be rejected with reason
Steps: 1. Open permit; 2. Click Reject; 3. Enter reason; 4. Confirm
Expected Result: Status changes to rejected; reason recorded; requester notified

Title: Activate approved permit
Preconditions: Approved permit with all pre-work controls complete
Steps: 1. Open approved permit; 2. Click Activate; 3. Confirm
Expected Result: Status changes to active; actual_start set; appears on board

Title: Reject activation if pre-work incomplete
Preconditions: Approved permit with incomplete pre-work controls
Steps: 1. Try to activate permit

Title: Complete pre-work control
Steps: 1. Click control checkbox; 2. Confirm
Expected Result: Control marked complete with user and timestamp

Title: Complete during-work control
Steps: 1. Complete during-work control

Title: Complete post-work control
Steps: 1. Complete post-work control

Title: Close active permit
Preconditions: Active permit with all post-work complete
Steps: 1. Click Close Permit; 2. Enter notes; 3. Confirm
Expected Result: Status changes to closed; actual_end set; removed from board

Title: Reject closure if post-work incomplete
Steps: 1. Try to close permit

Title: Suspend active permit
Steps: 1. Click Suspend; 2. Enter reason; 3. Confirm
Expected Result: Status changes to suspended; shows on board with suspended indicator

Title: Resume suspended permit
Steps: 1. Click Resume; 2. Confirm

Title: Cancel permit
Steps: 1. Click Cancel; 2. Enter reason; 3. Confirm

Title: Auto-expire permit
Steps: 1. Wait for cron job to run (or trigger manually)
Expected Result: Status changes to expired; removed from active board

Title: View active permits on board
Steps: 1. Navigate to Permit Board
Expected Result: All active permits displayed as cards

Title: Filter board by site
Steps: 1. Select Site filter: Warehouse A

Title: Filter board by permit type
Steps: 1. Select Type filter: Hot Work

Title: View countdown timer
Steps: 1. View permit card

Title: Warning color when <2h remaining
Steps: 1. View permit card

Title: Critical color when <30min remaining
Steps: 1. View permit card
Expected Result: Card shows red critical indicator; possibly pulsing

Title: Auto-refresh board
Steps: 1. Wait for refresh interval
Expected Result: Board updates to reflect closed permit

Title: Quick actions from board card
Steps: 1. Click View/Suspend/Close from card

Title: Detect overlapping permits same location
Steps: 1. Create new permit at same location and time
Expected Result: Conflict warning displayed with existing permit details

Title: Detect incompatible permit types
Preconditions: Hot Work permit active; try Confined Space nearby
Steps: 1. Create conflicting permit

Title: Show conflict warning on creation
Steps: 1. Enter conflicting details

Title: Allow permit creation despite warning
Steps: 1. Acknowledge warning; 2. Proceed with creation
Expected Result: Permit created; conflict noted in record

Title: Generate permit PDF
Steps: 1. Click Download PDF

Title: PDF includes all controls
Steps: 1. Generate PDF; 2. View controls section
Expected Result: All controls listed with completion status

Title: PDF includes worker list
Steps: 1. Generate PDF

Title: PDF includes approval signature
Steps: 1. Generate PDF
Expected Result: Approver name and approval timestamp shown

Title: Viewer cannot create chemicals
Steps: 1. Navigate to Chemicals; 2. Look for Add button
Expected Result: Add button not visible or disabled

Title: Reporter cannot approve permits
Preconditions: User logged in as Reporter; submitted permit exists
Steps: 1. Open submitted permit; 2. Look for Approve button
Expected Result: Approve button not visible or disabled

Title: Supervisor can approve permits
Steps: 1. Open submitted permit; 2. Approve

Title: Manager can approve and activate
Steps: 1. Approve permit; 2. Activate permit

Title: Cross-org chemical access blocked
Preconditions: Chemical in Org A; User in Org B
Steps: 1. Try to access chemical via direct URL

Title: Cross-org permit access blocked
Preconditions: Permit in Org A; User in Org B
Steps: 1. Try to access permit via direct URL

Title: JWT validation on all endpoints
Steps: 1. Call API endpoint without token

Title: Chemicals scoped to organisation
Steps: 1. Query chemicals as Org A user

Title: Permits scoped to organisation
Steps: 1. Query permits as Org A user

Title: Permit types scoped to organisation
Preconditions: Custom permit types in multiple orgs
Steps: 1. Query permit types as Org A user
Expected Result: Only Org A custom types (plus system types) returned

Title: Storage locations scoped to org sites
Preconditions: Chemical with locations at Org A sites
Steps: 1. View chemical storage locations
Expected Result: Only locations at user's org sites shown
